newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi Oil chairman, v.president to resign.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi Oil chairman, v.president to resign.

text.p: Mitsubishi Oil Co Ltd said on Friday its chairman Kikuo Yamada will resign and become an advisor to the oil firm effective March 31.
The company did not give a reason for the resignation.
Vice president Masafumi Kishi will also resign and become an advisor, Mitsubishi said in a statement.
Yamada came under fire over a series of oil product deals with Mitsui Mining Co Ltd brokered by Osaka-based oil wholesaler Junichi Izui.
Izui was indited in November on charges of evading 330 million yen in income tax on oil trade commissions between 1992 and 1994.
